body: I also met this problem, and I don't know how to solve it, if u have any solution please tell me, THX!

issue.title: Gradients do not exist for variables

repository.name: bert-for-tf2
repository.description: A Keras TensorFlow 2.0 implementation of BERT, ALBERT and adapter-BERT.

issue.body:

body: @Arkin1 @fakerbrother - yes, some of the weights in the checkpoint might not be used/needed by the model - e.g. `token_type_embeddings` is not used because your model does not feed the `segment_ids`,  the other weights  `cls/*` are only used during pre-training for the MLM task, and usually not needed during fine-tunning. The `bert/pooler` weights are actually not pre-trained and can as well be replaced by randomly initialized classifier.
